div.p: P90/2413, unit 501, VPRS 3992/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

I have the honor to report, that by some inadvertence during a very busy time I missed, to apply for authority, to spend out of the vote for "publication of works" £110 additionally to the £250, authorized by Order in Council (Correspondence 6934)
possible to x-ref this?
for the printing of the "Second Census of Australian plants" to completion. May I now solicit, that the honorable the Chief Secretary will be pleased, to make the additional permission, the funds being available for the purpose, and the cost of printing having exceeded the original estimate on account of the greater extension of the work, the number of pages being now 244.
The Chief Secretary, A. Deakin, approved M's request on 4 March 1890, and M returned the file 'with best thanks' on 7 March. Wilson then forwarded it to the Commissioners of Audit for their information who replied saying that 'as the excess expenditure is over £100 an Order in Council is necessary'. The Chief Secretary duly made such a request. p/c of the letterpress is poor and the specific date in April is illegible on it.
